body.p: To His Excellency B Magoffin Governor of Kentucky --

Your petitioners would respectfully represent, that at the Sept 1861_of the Oldham Circuit Court, that a judgment was rendered in favor of the Commonwealth vs Thos Basye for Fifty dollars on an Indictment for selling liquor to one Albert Holtzclaw_ without the consent of his guardian or parents -- Said Holtzclaw deposed before the jury, that about a week before the finding of the indictment, that defendant sold him one drink without the Consent in writing of his parents -- Your petitioner Basye states that said testimony was false & that he never sold said Hotzclaw any liquor whatever_ That said boy was induced as he believes through Malice to make said statement. That he is of bad reputation & not entitled to credit of on oath --

Yoru petitions state that said Hotzclaw the witness above named is of bad character and not entitled
to credit on oath. & we Hope that your exellency will remit the fine imposed on said Basye belonging as we do that this cause present strong grounds for executive clemency --
